title: Medication API Routes
description:
Create REST API for Medication Management with Drug Interaction Checking

Develop a comprehensive REST API that enables CRUD operations for medication records and provides automated drug interaction warnings when medications are prescribed or modified.

Requirements:

API Endpoints:
- POST /api/medications - Add new medication to patient record
- GET /api/medications/:patientId - Retrieve all medications for a patient
- GET /api/medications/:id - Get specific medication details
- PUT /api/medications/:id - Update medication information
- DELETE /api/medications/:id - Remove medication from record

Drug Interaction Features:
- Check for drug-drug interactions when adding or updating medications
- Return severity levels (critical, moderate, minor) for identified interactions
- Include interaction mechanism and clinical recommendations
- Support checking against patient's complete medication list

Data Model Requirements:
- Medication name, dosage, frequency, start date, end date
- Prescribing physician information
- Patient identifier for association
- Timestamps for audit trail

Validation and Error Handling:
- Validate medication dosage ranges
- Require critical fields (patient ID, medication name, dosage)
- Return appropriate HTTP status codes (200, 201, 400, 404, 500)
- Provide clear error messages for validation failures

Drug Interaction Database:
- Integrate with drug interaction database/API (specify source: FDA, DrugBank, etc.)
- Handle API failures gracefully with fallback behavior
- Cache interaction data to reduce external API calls

Security Considerations:
- Implement authentication/authorization for all endpoints
- Ensure patients can only access their own medication records
- Log all medication changes for compliance/audit purposes

Response Format:
- Return consistent JSON structure across all endpoints
- Include interaction warnings in response when adding/updating medications
- Provide pagination for medication lists if needed

Testing Requirements:
- Unit tests for interaction detection logic
- Integration tests for all API endpoints
- Test cases for various interaction scenarios
- Verify proper handling of concurrent updates
